explains: adj. 闪烁的，忽隐忽现的；摇曳的
v. 闪烁（flicker 的 ing 形式）
wordGroup: flickering light 闪光灯；闪烁光

sentences.en: There was something strange about the flickering blue light.
sentences.cn: 那闪烁的蓝光有点儿奇怪。

sentences.en: She became distantly aware that the light had grown strangely brighter and was flickering gently.
sentences.cn: 她模糊地意识到光线奇怪地变得明亮起来，轻轻摇曳着。

sentences.en: Coal gas rivaled smoky oil lamps and flickering candles, and early in the new century, well-to-do Londoners grew accustomed to gaslit houses and even streets.
sentences.cn: 煤气可与烟雾缭绕的油灯和摇曳不定的蜡烛相媲美，在新世纪之初，富裕的伦敦人逐渐习惯了有煤气照明的房子，甚至街道。
